data.title: Excellent family run pizza in Uptown Vancouver.
data.text: This longstanding Pizza restaurant in Uptown Vancouver is always busy and promises some of the most unique pizzas around.

data.title: One of our favorites
data.text: These folks give you excellent service as well as value. They are very family or adult friendly.  The menu is varied .. something for everyone; meat eaters, vegetarian, gluten free. Many sauces.  They sponsor family events and have been more than helpful for us when with my autistic nephew.  I highly recommend.

data.title: My pizza was soggy with grease and gross!
data.text: Ordered a pepperoni pizza to go and when we went to eat it, it was soaked in grease.  The sauce was really strong tasting and the meat was under the cheese and I hate pizzas that are made like that anyway cause the grease has no place to go but into the crust...nasty!

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text:
We had a long day seeing sights in, and around, Vancouver and were back in our hotel room, hungry for someone to bring us food so we didn't have to go back out again. Trying to find a pizza place that delivers to random hotels that isn't a chain can be hard. But we found this place and decided to give it a try. The service over the phone was great. They were very friendly and called right back when our phone accidentally disconnected. 
The pizza was good. Better than the average chain, for sure. The sauce was a little sweeter than we normally like, but really not bad enough to complain about. The pepperoni were large and super tasty. The sausage was just the right amount of spicy. 
Overall, good food and recommended.

data.title: pizza
data.text: We go to Vancouver pizza for the gluten free pizza and the beer.  The service is good and the pizza is great

data.title: It's good.
data.text: The pizza's crust is great. occasionally they over cook it, but the majority of the time they don't. In the Summer it is a nice outdoor eat if you are walking around downtown Vancouver with a friend, or whatnot. I believe there are 6 or so beers on tap. They are on the pricier side of pizza, but the ambiance on the inside is nice enough for a casual date. It is cute and unique on the inside because of fun paintings that are painted on the walls.

data.title: Good pizza but a little expensive for what you get
data.text: Me and my friends went to the Thirsty Sasquatch down the street and ordered a pizza from The Vancouver Pizza Co.  I'm not a huge fan of pizza but it was very good.  Sauce had a nice flavor that wasn't overpowering and you could tell the cheese and toppings were fresh.  Large pizza feed 4 adults. I felt it was a little overpriced ($30 for a large), but the table delivery was convenient.

data.title: Delicious pizza, excellent service
data.text: Exploring  Main Street in Vancouver and decided to have pizza for lunch here.  It was not crowded but had a steady stream who came in for takeout or just a slice. We shared a pizza getting our favorites on half (anchovies, yuk!) and we didn't leave a crumb (or a crust). Our server was prompt with any requests and we enjoyed a chat with her at the end of the meal. Would definitely make this a regular stop if we lived here.

data.title: Excellent Gluten-Free Pizza
data.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by how delicious the gluten-free pizza was at Vancouver Pizza Company. Quality toppings, crispy crust and good portions. My colleague and I shared a 13" and there was a lot of pizza leftover. Great waitstaff. Highly recommended!

data.title: Its ok
data.text: The cheese bread was good.  We enjoyed most of the sauces.  Lots of options to pick from.  The pizza is ok.  Its not the best pizza in town and there are plenty of options across the river.  Beer list was ok.  We had a waitress in training so service was a bit slow but she was still very nice.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: Vancouver Pizza offers a nice selection of pizza's and salads.  They make a garlic bread pizza that is fantastic!

data.title: Now that's a PIZZA PIE!
data.text: On main street in downtown Vancouver is the best family pizza joint in town. Now it's not the best pizza I've ever had but their bread sticks certainly are. I encourage all to order the B2 bread sticks as its more like a pizza than a bread stick and its delicious. They must use high end products to make their pizza because you can taste the quality. If you are in a hurry this would not be the place to dine. This quality takes time and patience. Picking up an order, call 30 minutes before. Cute dine in area and outside seating when the weather is mild. If you arrive early for pickup they will offer you a free beverages while you wait and if they make a mistake, they will make it right and then some.

data.title: Treated like family
data.text:
We arrived just before the dinner rush on Saturday night. They managed to find a seat for everyone, although they had to set up tables and move ours down to fit in another one as the night progressed. We got a free dessert out of the deal, which was a delicious giant cookie with ice cream that we devoured.

They are located in a prime location, right on main street across from a busy dispensary. There were a mix of locals and Portlander's. An older gentleman came by periodically to make sure we were comfortable and apologized for the noise and chaos. Everyone working there stopped by at some point to take care of us. Even though it was so busy, we were well taken care of. The food was also amazing.

When I went to the bathroom, there was a changing table and a collage of upbeat letters talking about how they couldn't wait for the restaurant to reopen after a fire.

All in all, this was a very welcoming and family friendly place.

data.title: So good! Great price! Good amount!
data.text: We are staying at a local hotel and needed to feed ourselves and the kids. So I found this pizza place online and they delivered. We didn't expect it to be great, but we were wrong! We ordered 3 different gourmet sandwiches and a Caesar salad to feed 2 adults, a teenager and 3 kids. Perfect amount of food and it didn't Brea the bank. They delivered to our hotel rm door. Quick de we also. We are impressed!

data.title: That's Amore!
data.text: This is a friendly family style pizzeria located on our Main Street. We like to order the specialty vegetarian pizzas. We ordered a large Botticelli vegetarian pizza and it was  excellent. the crust was thin and crisp; the topping was an interesting mix of basil pesto sauce, fresh garlic, spinach leaves, artichoke hearts, broccoli, feta and mozzarella cheeses. The bill was under $30 dollars...very reasonable for dinner for two. Wait staff were friendly and attentive.  Parking was easily available on the street. Seating is indoor/outdoor.

data.title: The absolute best gluten free pizza anywhere!
data.text: Literally, I'll fly across the country just to have their pizza.  It's really the best I've ever had.  The crust is delicious and chewy and thick, not like the usual flat ones around.  There's plenty of space inside, and in the nice weather, you can sit on their streetside patio.  I can't rave enough about their gluten free pizza!  And friends say that their regular pizza is even better!

data.title: Hit or Miss...and the Misses are Very, Very Bad
data.text:
It's understandable that places have an "off" day once in a while where the food/experience just isn't on par with previous visits. Vancouver Pizza frequently has off days, but the off days aren't just, "This isn't quite as good as last time." They're more like, "Did they quick making their own pizza today and just decide to serve cheap, frozen pizza?" We had several pizzas in a row recently that were great, but tonight ordered a 
pizza that was so bad we could only eat a piece each. Same pizza we ordered the last several times. And we are not pizza snobs---Donat's and Papa John's will do most nights. Vancouver Pizza is too pricey to serve such sub-par pizzas. Like I said, they're entitled to an off night, but it seems to happen frequently, and their off nights are really, really off.

data.title: IT OK
data.text: We had the Salad and pizza . The sauce was very good on the pizza. Not sure we would come back. Price is the some all over.

data.title: Average Pizza, Slow Service, Good Beverage Choices
data.text: Depends what you are looking for.  I went with a child who wanted to eat.  We ordered one slice each and it was pretty good so I went to the counter and ordered another. At that point the staff seemed overwhelmed and after waiting 20 minutes for them to warm up two slices of pizza I was told it would be up soon.  The pizza isn't bad it is

data.title: OK if your choices are limited
data.text: We ended up at this place because my son and I needed to get some dinner on Valentine's night and all the other nearby Italian places were booked up. I had a sausage sandwich and my son had a calzone. Both were just OK. We also got an order of bread sticks which ended up just being a pizza crust cut into strips, which was kind of disappointing. I ordered a salad and I got iceberg lettuce instead of mixed greens, which was odd because it was the waiter who actually asked me which I wanted since I didn't initially specify. Also the pizza sauce they gave us to dip the crust slices (bread sticks) into was really cold, like refrigerated cold. I asked the manager to get us some warm sauce, and he did, but he said it's supposed to be cold for health regulations. Which of course isn't true, since any restaurant is capable of heating things up right before they serve them.
